page.title: 11Wareham Health Centre.
page.content: The doctors at the centre are self-employed but pay R.G.N.(S.R.N.) to assist them.The doctors are paid by the National Health Service,but buy their own equipment as needed despite increasing costs. The busiest times of the year are Summer and Winter.Summer because of tourists suffering the usual summer complaints e.g. sunburn,and Winter because of respiratory problems e.g coughs and colds. More serious cases which cannot be dealt with at the clinic, are sent to Poole,Dorchester or Weymouth Hospital for treatment.This happens usually 2 to 3 times a day.Prescriptions can be purchased through the chemist at the clinic. Con'td on Pg 12
